item.title: Tiqets: App Clip on Apple Map
item.description: Tiqets Appclip directly integrated AppClip on Apple Map. Available for Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam, Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, MoMA in New York and more!

item.title: SyncVR Medical: VR headset controller on iPad
item.description: SyncV Medical is a company that develops VR solutions used in a medical environment. I have built an iOS app that communicates with VR headsets so that nurses can guide patients wearing VR headsets from a tablet device during treatment.

item.title: Sense Labs: React Native bridge for iOS Health Kit
item.description: React Native SDK for iOS Health Kit. It enabled React Native apps to subscribe Health Kit data updates.

item.title: Tiqets: Filterable Map
item.description: Filterable items on map component. A common iOS UI pattern that can be found in many apps.

item.title: Tiqets: Sticky Header on a collection view
item.description: A sticky header on a collection view.

item.title: Hobby: Gesture Dismissible Sticky Banner with Swift UI
item.description: Interactive Banner in Swift UI. You can snap up to dismiss.

item.title: Tiqets: Magical Tickets Fetch
item.description: Tickets being automatically available right after installation. It’s magic!

item.title: Network Demo with Swift UI and MVVM
item.description: An app to demostrate how network calls can be implemented in a SwiftUI/MVVM app. Motivations Apple’s introductory tutorial is a great starting point to learn about SwiftUI (https://developer.apple.com/tutorials/swiftui). However, it doesn’t cover many things that an app in a production app would need: Network calls Being able to communicate with many endpoints without code duplication Concurrency Network calls that depends on the other calls' results Error handling Logging Navigation Test When I tried to extend my app after finishing the tutorial, I still had to make many decisions about how to organise the codebase.

item.title: SwiftUI: Success Animation
item.description: A simple implementation of a success animation. Source code available at: https://github.com/kanekin/SwiftUISuccessAnimation
